com.okta.sdk.http

Interface HttpRequestBuilder

  • Deprecated. 
    Not used

    @Deprecated
public interface HttpRequestBuilder
    A Builder design pattern used to construct HttpRequest instances.

    The HttpRequestBuilder is useful to build HttpRequest instances for developers that don't have access to the Servlet container, and therefore, cannot execute operations using implementations of the javax.servlet.HttpServlet api.

    Since:
    0.5.0
    See Also:
    HttpRequest, HttpRequests

      Adds a request header that will be part of the headers map in the resulting request instance.

      Deprecated. 
      Adds a request parameter that will be part of the parameters map in the resulting request instance.
      HttpRequest build()
      Deprecated. 
      Returns a new HttpRequest instance reflecting the current builder state.
      HttpRequestBuilder headers(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> headers)

      • addHeader

        HttpRequestBuilder addHeader(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String[] value)
        Deprecated. 
        Adds a request header that will be part of the headers map in the resulting request instance.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the HTTP header that will be present in the resulting HTTP request instance.
        value - the value of the HTTP header that will be present in the resulting HTTP request instance.
        Returns:
        the builder instance for method chaining.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the name or value arguments are null.

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the name or value arguments are null.
